page.title: 19TOWN PLAN
page.content: In 1985 the{Wymondham Town 10 year {Plan}was published, amid objections. Chapel Lane residents objected to buildings opposite their homes because it would spoil the view of the valley. Pedestrianisation was suggested because so many lorries came through the town centre. The shopkeepers thought it would take away trade. The proposals suggested moving a bowling green to Kings Head Meadow and the use of the vacated space for car_parking.The local bowls club and football team objected to that. The S.N.D.C. wanted to put a large estate on Harts Farm. The W.T.C. said it should be in small patches to avoid social problems. Local people are against moving Browick Road recreation ground to Tuttles Lane because the site is away from the town centre and too wet.{
